Physicians should practice what they teach. They should teach that by studying after nine o'clock, there is nothing gained but much lost. Teach and 


                                    -331- 

practice that the time can be systematically employed, one duty after another attended to promptly, not allowed to lag, so that midnight hours will not have to be employed in laborious studies.--Letter 85, 1888, p. 9. (To Brethren Caldwell and Gibbs, May 10, 1888.)
